segments.pli: Piṇḍapātapārisuddhisutta
segments.en: The Purification of Alms

segments.pli: Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
segments.en: So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, Sāriputta came out of retreat and went to the Buddha. He bowed and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him,

segments.pli: “Vippasannāni kho te, sāriputta, indriyāni, parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
segments.en: “Sāriputta, your faculties are so very clear, and your complexion is pure and bright.

segments.pli: Katamena kho tvaṃ, sāriputta, vihārena etarahi bahulaṃ viharasī”ti?
segments.en: What kind of meditation are you usually practicing these days?”

segments.pli: “Suññatāvihārena kho ahaṃ, bhante, etarahi bahulaṃ viharāmī”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, these days I usually practice the meditation on emptiness.”

segments.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, sāriputta.
segments.en: “Good, good, Sāriputta!

segments.pli: Mahāpurisavihārena kira tvaṃ, sāriputta, etarahi bahulaṃ viharasi.
segments.en: It seems you usually practice the meditation of a great man.

segments.pli: Mahāpurisavihāro eso, sāriputta, yadidaṃ—
segments.en: For emptiness is the meditation of a great man.

segments.pli: suññatā.
Tasmātiha, sāriputta, bhikkhu sace ākaṅkheyya:
segments.en: Now, a mendicant might wish:

segments.pli: ‘suññatāvihārena bahulaṃ vihareyyan’ti, tena, sāriputta, bhikkhunā iti paṭisañcikkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: ‘May I usually practice the meditation on emptiness.’ So they should reflect:

segments.pli: ‘yena cāhaṃ maggena gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisiṃ, yasmiñca padese piṇḍāya acariṃ, yena ca maggena gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamiṃ, atthi nu kho me tattha cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu chando vā rāgo vā doso vā moho vā paṭighaṃ vāpi cetaso’ti?
segments.en: ‘Along the path that I went for alms, or in the place I wandered for alms, or along the path that I returned from alms, was there any desire or greed or hate or delusion or repulsion in my heart for sights known by the eye?’

segments.pli: Sace, sāriputta, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṃ jānāti:
segments.en: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that

segments.en: there was such desire or greed or hate or delusion or repulsion in their heart, they should make an effort to give up those unskillful qualities.

segments.pli: Ye hi keci, sāriputta, atītamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā piṇḍapātaṃ parisodhesuṃ, sabbe te evameva paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā piṇḍapātaṃ parisodhesuṃ.
segments.en: Whether in the past, future, or present, all those who purify their alms-food do so by continually checking in this way.

segments.pli: Yepi hi keci, sāriputta, anāgatamaddhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā piṇḍapātaṃ parisodhessanti, sabbe te evameva paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā piṇḍapātaṃ parisodhessanti.
Yepi hi keci, sāriputta, etarahi samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā piṇḍapātaṃ parisodhenti, sabbe te evameva paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā piṇḍapātaṃ parisodhenti.
Tasmātiha, sāriputta, ‘paccavekkhitvā paccavekkhitvā piṇḍapātaṃ parisodhessāmā’ti—
segments.en: So, Sāriputta, you should all train like this: ‘We shall purify our alms-food by continually checking.’”

segments.pli: evañhi vo, sāriputta, sikkhitabban”ti.
Idamavoca bhagavā.
segments.en: That is what the Buddha said.

segments.pli: Attamano āyasmā sāriputto bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandīti.
segments.en: Satisfied, Venerable Sāriputta was happy with what the Buddha said.

segments.pli: Piṇḍapātapārisuddhisuttaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ navamaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha notices Venerable Sāriputta’s glowing complexion, which is the result of his deep meditation. He then presents a series of reflections by which a mendicant can be sure that they are worthy of their alms-food.
